page.title: 03LIFE AT SCHOOL ON EARTH
page.content:
(Extract from "Moon News")
Hi folks! We recently beamed down to a school called Northumberland Heath. The beings all wear white shirts, blue ties, blue pullovers and grey trousers (boys), and skirts (girls)-wierd! They start school at 9.00a.m., at 9.10a.m. they have assembly. Lessons are maths, English, project work, art, music and sport. They have 15 minutes playtime at 10.30a.m. and 2.15p.m.. Lunch is 12.00-1.15, some children have a cooked meal for 66p. (Today sausage, potato and peas, then ice cream - yum yum!) Others bring sandwiches. There are 35 children in one class (aged 9, 10 and 11). Winter games are soccer (mainly boys), netball (mainly girls) and in summer - rounders. Swimming once a week for 10 and 11 year olds. School ends at 3.30p.m..
